class.name: CobbAPIForm
class.blurb: Functions for working with forms in general.

method.name: GetBounds
method.blurb: Returns an array of the form's bounds.

description.p: This function returns an array of the form's bounds, as defined in the form's Object Bounds (OBND) data. This is the data that gets filled when you right-click on a form in the Creation Kit and select "Recalc Bounds."
The returned data consists of six integers, which define the 3D coordinates for a "min" point and a "max" point. This is enough data to infer a full oriented bounding box.
This function returns the specified form's editor ID. Note that most forms do not actually load their editor IDs during gameplay.
Currently, CobbAPI patches the following form types to load editor IDs when they normally wouldn't:

method.name: GetEditorIDs

args.arg: An array of forms for which editor IDs should be retrieved. If any elements in this array are None, an empty string will be returned for the corresponding index in the result array.

method.blurb: Returns an array of editor IDs for the specified forms.

method.name: IsDefiniteItem

args.arg: A base form to be tested, or an ObjectReference whose base form will be tested.

method.blurb: Returns true if the form is an item, and not a leveled item.

description.p: This function returns True if the form is a item, and False otherwise.

Specifically, this function returns True if the form is: a scroll; a piece of armor; a book; an alchemy ingredient; a misc. item; an alchemy apparatus (which is an unused item type left over from Oblivion); a weapon; ammunition; a key; a potion (including food); a note; a soul gem; a light that has been flagged as "carryable;" or an ObjectReference whose base form is any of the preceding.
